intro: Erigeron tilingii, commonly known as the Tiling's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, which bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron tilingii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
